comment._content:
wow, nice pic.
Many Thanks to flickr

comment.author: 83382282@N00
comment._content:
I doubt whether this is a durbar or a religious procession as the wagon seems to have a religious mark (the vaishnavite mark of namam, the chakra and the chanka) on the front side, just behind the elephants. But considering the building in the picture to be of north Indian type, it's quite surprising to see the religious mark quite prevalent in south India on the wagon.

Also quite visible in the photo are the white caps of British who are watching the procession from the stand. A really precious photograph indeed.

comment.author: 10464819@N05
comment._content: I agree with techofreak, we should perhaps look at Hyderabad  state as the mark is definitely the same.

comment.author: 8448875@N08
comment._content: This is more likely a photograph from Delhi Durbar in 1903 (although it is put as taken in 1910). The carriage is of Mahraja of Rewa as seen here on Wikipedia. More details avaiable in this wikipedia article.

comment.author: 20971323@N00
comment._content: must be a gift to Maharaja of Rewa from a South Indian king!

comment.author: 24044074@N08
comment._content: Pickler's II Pro is probably right.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Indranil Banerjie:  Pickler's II is definitely on to something with the link to the 1903 Durbar event and the carriage of H.H the Maharaja of Rewah.  For more images of this event, check out the library's stereograph images in  LOT 12547.  We will enhance the title of this image and correct the date the next time we update the record.  Thank you!
